result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian L Therkelsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed
Is eligible for the BHS in-jail program. 
Credit for time served to be used only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week. Obtain high school diploma or equivalent.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Comply with AODA program and any programming as required.   Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Christian L Therkelsen in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - Plea to Cts 1, 3 & 5 in 14CF1408, DRI Cts 2 & 4, and 14CF1513
Rights given
P - Cts 1 & 3 Guilty; Ct 5 No Contest
BTC: Finding of guilt Cts 1, 3 and 5. DRI Cts 2 & 4, and 14CF1513. 

Each Ct - 4 Mos RCJ I&S - consecutive
Credit for time served to be applied if revoked
Is eligible for BHS in-jail program

90 Days RCJ I&S
No alc/cs
Comply w/AODA program and any programming as req'd
Obtain HS diploma or equivalent
FT employment
DNA and surcharge on each Ct
Count 1 - $1,000 plus cc
Count 3 - Court costs
Count 5 - Waive costs

Def may petition for expungment after successful completion of probation and treatment program, payment of fines, obtained HS diploma.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Christian L Therkelsen in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Def - Req COP/sentencing date  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Christian L Therkelsen in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Christian L Therkelsen in court with Student Jillian under attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Christian L Therkelsen in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter Mark Garvin.   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
